101.description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with the community and speakers around
101.title: Registration & morning Coffee

102.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the organizers, sponsors and partners.
102.title: GDG DevFest Dublin 2019 Opening

103.description: There are many different ways to run your code these days. And the tradeoffs are different when you're working with existing systems as opposed to designing an entirely new system. Google Cloud Platform offers solid support for the full spectrum of compute models, whether you are using managed Google Cloud offerings or open-source technologies. Come learn how to navigate the trade-offs and decide which models are the best fit for your systems as well as how the models map to Google Cloud services.
103.title: Where I should run my code

104.description: Cloud AutoML is a suite of machine learning products that enables developers with limited machine learning expertise to train high-quality models specific to their needs, by leveraging Google’s state-of-the-art neural architecture search technology. Learn the power and ease-of-use of Cloud AutoML Tables, Video Intelligence, and Natural Language.
104.title: Train Custom Machine Learning Models with No Data Science Expertise

105.description: The tech industry’s focus on Big Data for the past few years has resulted in companies storing huge quantities of user data on their systems. The reward for attackers, financial or otherwise, has never been higher. Android apps are disproportionally more likely to be used as an attack vector than their iOS counterparts
105.title: You will be hacked. What to do about it?

106.description: A total crash course in getting started building an Angular application using the Angular CLI for total beginners. A chance for anyone that's been interested in learning Angular but hasn't had a chance to get round to it. A simple walk through tutorial that will be deployed to Firebase (by participants that get that far through the example). Followed up by a summary of resources, where to continue their studies after the workshop if they are interested in learning more about Angular and/or Firebase.
106.title: From zero to hero: a crash course in Angular for total beginners

107.description: In this talk, you will learn how to collect images from IoT-class devices and classify the image data on Google Cloud using the Machine Learning API. We'll start by connecting a device to Google Cloud using IoT Core, will show you how to classify images of a switch using the AutoML API, and will store the classifications in Cloud SQL. At the conclusion of the talk you will have a starting point for turning aspects of a factory into a smart building.
107.title: Machine Learning and IoT

108.description: MotionLayout is a new layout based on ConstraintLayout. With MotionLayout, animations and transitions finally are becoming easier to implement. In this talk, you will learn how to use this component starting with building some simple animations, then as we move on i will use KeyFrames, KeyCycles, KeyPosition and other awesome features of MotionLayout in order to create animations more complicated. I'll show some gifs and some parts of code in order to explain these features properly, all of them will be available on Github.
108.title: Animate your app with MotionLayout

109.description: Get a project live from an idea is a long journey, full of obstacles that you need to overcome. Angular gives you a variety of tools to make this path simpler and at the same robust. I will show you tips, code, and strategies that my team and I followed to bring a prototype to a fully functional web app deployed to production.
109.title: From prototype to production with Angular

111.description: The Gradle Kotlin DSL is all about improving the developer experience. Having a type safe language with fantastic IDE support makes it much much easier to configure and refactor your gradle files and build logic, giving you instant feedback as you're typing and avoiding a lot of runtime surprises that you get with groovy. In this talk I'll be running through a step by step guide to migrate your gradle files to the Gradle Kotlin DSL, and showing you all the things you need to watch out for.
111.title: Migrating to the Gradle Kotlin DSL - A Step by Step Guide

112.description: Interested to learn how Google approaches Digital Wellbeing? Curious what it’s like to develop features at Google? In this talk, we will start by providing background on the problem Digital Wellbeing aims to solve. We will then discuss the features we’ve launched, and get an inside view into the tech details of how some of our features are actually implemented - with some fun stories of challenges we’ve faced along the way!
112.title: Digital Wellbeing for Android: Tech Talk

114.description: Join Laura to work on a Tensorflow Hands-On. Learn how to use Tensorflow with Keras and work on a fun project that you can take home and work on it
114.title: Tensorflow Hands-on

katie_mclaughlin.bio:
Katie is a Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, and serves on the board for the Python and Django Software Foundations.
When she's not changing the world, she enjoys making tapestries, cooking, and seeing just how well various application stacks handle emoji.
katie_mclaughlin.name: Katie McLaughlin
katie_mclaughlin.shortBio: Katie is a Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, and serves on the board for the Python and Django...
katie_mclaughlin.title: Developer Advocate, Google Cloud

torry_yang.bio:
Torry is an engineer at Google, where he works to improve the experience of machine learning developers on Google Cloud.
Torry enjoys snowboarding and has recently started bouldering and Krav Maga.
torry_yang.name: Torry Yang
torry_yang.shortBio: Torry is an engineer at Google, where he works to improve the experience of machine learning dev...
torry_yang.title: Engineer

gus_class.bio:
Gus Class has worked on the developer experience for Google's IoT products for the past 4 years and has been working on Cloud products since 2016. 
He builds LED projects, produces electronic music, and DJs in his spare time.
gus_class.name: Gus Class
gus_class.shortBio: Gus Class has worked on the developer experience for Google's IoT products...
gus_class.title: Developer Programs Engineer

matteo_pasotti.bio: Matteo is an Android Engineer at Booking (Manchester) with 5 years’ experience. He’s passionate about Kotlin and Design, and thus his favourite challenge is trying to create, in a native way, layouts and animations inspired by websites like Dribble or Muzli. He also enjoys sharing his knowledge with others by writing articles and tutorials.
matteo_pasotti.name: Matteo Pasotti
matteo_pasotti.title: Android Engineer

maurice_gavin.bio: Maurice is the Android Lead at Toothpic here in Dublin. He has been working with Android since 2010 and is currently using his skills to make quality dental care more accessible through teledentistry.
maurice_gavin.name: Maurice Gavin
maurice_gavin.shortBio: Maurice is the Android Lead at Toothpic here in Dublin. He has been working with Android since 2010.
maurice_gavin.title: Lead Android Engineer

fellyph_cintra.bio: Fellyph Cintra is a Front-end developer. Based in Ireland and he works at Deloitte Digital, The last year He has been promoting a digital transformation at the public sector,  passionated for web performance, accessibility and SEO. His first job as a Front-end was in 2006 since then so much happened he worked with different technologies but something that never changed, he always was involved supporting local developer communities, because he believes communities are tools of integration and social development. And 2019 he received the title of Google Developer Expert on Web Technologies in recognition of it.
fellyph_cintra.name: Fellyph Cintra
fellyph_cintra.shortBio: Fellyph Cintra is a Front-end developer passionated for web performance, accessibility and SEO.
fellyph_cintra.title: Senior Solutions Engineer

tomas_hanley.bio: Tom is a backend Java engineer turned passionate Kotliner. At Toast he has been instrumental in adopting Kotlin in their Android POS as well as backend services. He is a big proponent of Kotlin both in Toast and in the Dublin developer community, organising the Dublin Kotlin user group as well as presenting at the Google developer group, Belfast KUG, Kotlin Everywhere Boston, and KotlinConf in December. He has most recently been working on Kotlin Android libraries and Android card reader integrations at Toast. His hobbies include all things food, adventure racing, golfing, running and hiking.
tomas_hanley.name: Tomas Hanley
tomas_hanley.shortBio: Senior Software Engineer @Toast, Huge fan of Kotlin, Organiser of the Dublin Kotlin User Group
tomas_hanley.title: Senior Software Engineer

laura_uzcategui.bio: Laura is a Software Engineer at Workday in the Machine Learning platform team. Works with Flink, K8s, Golang/Java/Scala over the day. On her spare time organise GDG Cloud Dublin and have fun building stuff with Python and ML. She loves coffee, travel and books.
laura_uzcategui.name: Laura Uzcategui
laura_uzcategui.shortBio: Software Engineer @ Workday, Organiser of GDG Cloud Dublin.
laura_uzcategui.title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Platform

juarez_filho.bio: Writing code over the last decade for people amusement and to be readable/executable by machines. Born in Brazil. Living in Dublin with my lovely wife and the baby boy. Passionate about Mobile/Web Technologies and Firebase. Jesus Freak.
juarez_filho.name: Juarez Filho
juarez_filho.shortBio: Writing code over the last decade for people amusement and to be readable/executable by machines. Born in Brazil. Living in Dublin with my lovely wife and the baby boy. Passionate about Mobile/Web Technologies and Firebase. Jesus Freak.
juarez_filho.title: Senior Developer, GDE

anna_zappone.bio: Anna Zappone received a Bachelor of Science with Honors from Stanford University in 2017. Her primary interest is in ensuring technology respects user intention. Before joining Google, Anna co-founded a startup called Ship to let friends matchmake for each other. She has been on a diverse array of teams at Google - ranging from YouTube to Google Travel to Android Performance. Anna was one of the first developers on Digital Wellbeing for Android, and continues on the Digital Wellbeing team today. Anna spends her 20% time working with GirlGuiding UK on strategy through their Google partnership to increase diversity in tech.
anna_zappone.name: Anna Zappone
anna_zappone.shortBio: Anna Zappone is a software engineer on Digital Wellbeing for Android.
anna_zappone.title: Software Engineer III - Android

amy_louise.bio: Amy is a Software Engineer at Accenture, The Dock. She also organises Women Who Code Dublin
amy_louise.name: Amy Louise McCabe
amy_louise.shortBio: Amy is a Software Engineer at Accenture, The Dock. She also organises Women Who Code Dublin
amy_louise.title: Software Engineer

ricardo_larosa.bio: Ricardo is a Senior Software Engineer at Workday, experienced in Kubernetes, CI/CD, Devops. Organiser of GDG Cloud Dublin
ricardo_larosa.name: Ricardo La Rosa
ricardo_larosa.shortBio: Ricardo is a Senior Software Engineer at Workday, experienced in Kubernetes, CI/CD, Devops
ricardo_larosa.title: Software Engineer

justin_slade.bio: Justin is an Android Team Lead at Global Kinetic
justin_slade.name: Justin Slade
justin_slade.shortBio: Justin is an Android Team Lead at Global Kinetic
justin_slade.title: Android Team Lead

tickets.name: DevFest Ticket

ihor_dvoretskyi.bio:
Ihor serves as a Developer Advocate with Kubernetes specialization for Cloud Native Computing Foundation - the Linux Foundation project, focused on creating and driving the adoption of a new computing paradigm that is optimized for modern distributed systems environments.

Ihor holds the role of Product Manager for Kubernetes at Kubernetes Open Source Community, co-driving Product Management Special Interest Group; and Program Manager at Mirantis - company, which is offering Kubernetes-based commercial solutions and services.

Apart from the product management activities, Ihor acts as a OpenStack Special Interest group co-lead at Kubernetes Community, working intensely on the questions and abilities, related to OpenStack and Kubernetes collaboration and integration.

Prior to Mirantis, Ihor has been responsible for the projects, tightly bound to Cloud computing area, containerized workloads and Linux systems.
ihor_dvoretskyi.name: Ihor Dvoretskyi

2015.title: The Cloud Convergence: OpenStack and Kubernetes

2016.title: Application Delivery with OpenStack and Kubernetes

2017.title: Welcome to the world of Open Source. Stories by Kubernetes contributor
